oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John P. Jacobs to Miss Nancy Hayes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from beau Pvt. John P. Jacobs, Co. C, 23rd Tenn. Inf. CSA to Miss Hayes, reporting that "I am in fine health at the present and all of the boys are enjoying themselves the best they can." The 23rd was encamped at Bowling Green, KY before moving south with Gen. Simon B. Buckner's division. There is, however, no news of military life in this letter. It is entirely expressions of his devotion and eternal friendship for Miss Hayes.
